name: Introduction to Public Administration
description: This course explores the history of public administration, its role in government, and the various theories and methods used to study it.

name: Political Theory and Public Policy Analysis
description: This course explores the relationship between political theory and public policy analysis, examining the various ways in which these two aspects of politics are interconnected.

name: Public Budgeting and Finance
description: This course examines the principles of public budgeting and finance, exploring the various methods used to manage public funds and resources.
prerequisites: Political Theory and Public Policy Analysis

name: Public Management
description: This course explores the principles of public management, examining the various theories and methods used to manage public organizations.
prerequisites: Political Theory and Public Policy Analysis

name: Public Policy Analysis
description: This course examines the principles of public policy analysis, exploring the various ways in which policies are created, implemented, and evaluated.
prerequisites: Political Theory and Public Policy Analysis
